channel.title: The Paige Perspective
channel.description: In the podcast, Paige Sandgren (@beefnuggette on IG and creator of the Amazon Evolution Academy for women) shares bits of knowledge regarding training, nutrition, motivation, science, psychology, and human behavior insights. Learn more about her program at www.paigesandgren.com if you want to be a next-level woman with a strong mind & physique.
channel.author: Paige Sandgren
channel.itunes:author: Paige Sandgren
channel.itunes:summary: In the podcast, Paige Sandgren (@beefnuggette on IG and creator of the Amazon Evolution Academy for women) shares bits of knowledge regarding training, nutrition, motivation, science, psychology, and human behavior insights. Learn more about her program at www.paigesandgren.com if you want to be a next-level woman with a strong mind & physique.

item.title: Physical Triggers Of Binge Eating
item.description: Sometimes you have triggers that you don‚Äôt even realize, and these are a few to help you NOT binge when it‚Äôs easily avoidable.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Sometimes you have triggers that you don‚Äôt even realize, and these are a few to help you NOT binge when it‚Äôs easily avoidable.

item.title: Mindset, Mental Illness, & When Additional Help Is Necessary
item.description: I hope we can start to destigmatize mental illness because sometimes you do need to seek clinical help, and that‚Äôs nothing to be ashamed of. While my program does help immensely with changing your outlook on life, setting goals, stopping to binge, etc., it‚Äôs certainly not a cure-all.

item.title: Building A New Life

item.title: Really Being Real? Or BS?
item.description: Ask yourself this: how real are you being on social media? Do you like the physique of your idols or their personalities more? Do you know the entire context of their lives? If not, why do you compare yourself so much to them?

item.title: 4 Reasons Why You Binge
item.description: These are the 4 main reasons why you are binging. Plain and simple. item.title: Questions To Ask Yourself
item.description: In this episode, Paige rambles off some questions that you should take and run with. They seem simple but they lead you to a better understanding of your abilities and will help you achieve your goals.

item.description: You don‚Äôt have to be underweight or overweight to have an eating disorder. It‚Äôs not always visible. We discuss this plus the stigma of the word ‚Äúdisorder‚Äù itself.

item.title: Do Injuries Make You Stressed?
item.description: Have you ever received heavy news like an injury that will lay you up for a while, and you immediately become depressed? You assume you will fall out of shape? Why is that? We explore these reasons in this episode. Enjoy!

item.title: The Only Thing Better Than Motivation
item.description: You can‚Äôt keep relying on daily motivation if you want to reach your goals. Motivation is subjective, fleeting, and unpredictable. Why would you rely on something like that?

item.title: What Everyone Needs To Know When ‚ÄúResearching‚Äù Diets
item.description: On this episode, you‚Äôll learn why you shouldn‚Äôt be so quick to trust experts or those with credentials. This includes doctors/PhD recipients, CEOs, fit celebrities like Mark Wahlberg & their trainers, and even Dr. Oz. Everyone is biased, so the only way to do ‚Äútrue‚Äù research is to look at the real studies and watch out for correlation vs causation, cherry picking, and marketing.

item.title: Why Do People Hate Tony Robbins?
item.description: Everything is on a spectrum. In this random stream of consciousness, Paige discusses how humans have this innate desire to judge, seemingly in order to understand, and how that‚Äôs simultaneously just a waste of time. We don‚Äôt always see it this way because of short term gratification.

item.title: Climbing Mountains
item.description: On this episode, Paige uses a common metaphor to examine how athletic aspirations and extreme life accomplishments could positively or negatively affect your life, and why it‚Äôs important to be proactively self-aware as your perspective changes overtime.

item.title: Stop Labeling Food As ‚ÄúHealthy‚Äù
item.description: ‚ÄúHealthy‚Äù is a subjective term. Listen to the podcast to learn more about why calories matter, how the glycemic index DOESN‚ÄôT matter, and why you‚Äôre probably avoiding foods that you actually don‚Äôt have to avoid in order to improve your biomarkers and body composition.

item.title: Once Upon A Time, A Girl Tried Every Fad Diet
item.description: This girl that I‚Äôm referring to is me. People can often look at a physique and forget how long it took to build it, and how that person has changed over time. I used to be the average girl next door who was skinny fat, and now look where I am. It didn‚Äôt happen by chance.

item.title: The Importance Of Point A & Point B
item.description: Think of your life as a map. You might be able to use a compass, but you‚Äôll never get to point B (your goals) if you never figure out your point A (your current location).

item.title: 8 Reasons Why You Don‚Äôt Have Your Dream Body Yet
item.description: In order to change anything, you need to first be aware of the facts. Where are you today? What is your life like? What could be holding you back? It‚Äôs not always easy for ya to see because this is often painful, so we avoid the truth. Unfortunately, that‚Äôs not how you will grow. THIS is where growth starts. It starts now, and it starts with the facts.
